Lawrence Oluyede wrote:
> BTW I'd like to give CouchDB a try for my experiments one of 
> these days. Damien Katz decided to drop XML altogether 
> <http://damienkatz.net/2007/09/system_overload_1.html>

Yes CouchDB looks very cool, someone pointed it out to me the other day, and
it appears very RESTful; bravo!
Too bad it uses Erlang, and I only say that because of the difficulty for it
to reach wide-scale deployment at hosting companies in any near term
horizon.

> It seems he doesn't really like XML at all. But since that DB 
> is document oriented and doesn't care of what you put inside 
> you can still use XML as document format

heh!  +1 for what he said! :-)

-- 
-Mike Schinkel
